document.title: ARIZONA CTE PROGRAM STANDARDS & MEASUREMENT CRITERIA

F839782789F14E0CA4E2DCC86131AE22.description: Use databases, pharmacy computer applications, and documentation

FCDF42DE35B147DF98CB499C73BFECCB.description:
Describe pharmacy-related computer application for documenting the dispensing of prescriptions or
medication orders

113450218F4A4609A1F5DE2E5541CD0F.description:
DEMONSTRATE UNDERSTANDING OF PHARMACY INFORMATION SYSTEM USAGE AND
APPLICATION

2F12C664F60F42849FF1CB98D2E86FE2.description: Describe healthcare reimbursement systems (e.g., home health, long-term care, home infusion)

9634217C9AA94D1186D9CEE6C1A7459C.description: Explain third-party reimbursement systems (e.g., PBM, medication assistance programs, coupons, and selfpay)

307D6DF58CE14E48A749C19A1975E41E.description: Explain third-party resolution (e.g., prior authorization, rejected claims, and plan limitations)

1DCC054B46A341F9ACED602DCF000E53.description:
Describe various reimbursement policies and plans (e.g., HMOs, PPO, CMS, Private plans, and Medicare and
Medicaid)

5DE44603DBE1443596B779558A8C5323.description: Follow established practices to maintain a secure inventory to prevent theft by patients and staff

F9A74E7E35EA440481B574CE5C57AA98.description: Use the barcoding system to improve accuracy, increase productivity, and control inventory

39A47C85008F4DC58343277E01526AA1.description: Follow established practices related to remove items (e.g., recalls, returns, outdates, reverse distribution)

1A29F7D0DF4A4E548C53E7FF9299F7E9.description: Analyze how chemical stability affects the handling and storage of medications

64F9978C1E2A465188531C8E1CF1E67A.description: Follow established practices related to storage requirements (e.g., refrigeration, freezer, warmer, and lock up)

33251E1867894B579D91B9A8A6944161.description: Follow established practices to receiving items

4FB5473CEBF94B9DB410BCDCD107786D.description: Follow established practices to place drug and device orders by phone and electronically

A5A490FA1536476EB589BBD0AED7EACD.description: Use the formulary or approved/preferred product list or system

A42004A1EA0944D99B80370C5ADB03D4.description: Explain the function and application of the national drug code (NDC), lot numbers, and expiration dates

60D209793D634E2183B4221D8F9A328B.description: DEMONSTRATE KNOWLEDGE OF PHARMACY INVENTORY CONTROL

F18C498CACED49AD85382B5C77F4040A.description: Document information in an electronic or manual format

7945841ADF424CAAAA57798540FFD362.description: Highlight special requests on the prescription

2CAA1C31884647EFAC38D09F766BE2A8.description: Apply effective verbal and written communication skills

F8409AA48D6340A39B7F2F884A1CEEBA.description:
Use effective strategies for communicating with non-English speaking individuals or those with special needs
(e.g., vision or hearing problems, low reading level, difficulty understanding instructions)

9C131C832B2B45479D63181321030884.description: COLLECT AND RECORD INFORMATION FROM CUSTOMERS/PATIENTS

B9A7747EEAA14493BE33908C28B1540C.description: Identify situations when refills and renewals need to be reviewed by the pharmacist

82123A0C1E634BCB877334012100E964.description: Record prescription or medication order in patient’s profile

E8FD06EC03624C238A2BBF946F9705A7.description:
Follow the established protocol in dispensing and distributing drugs and medications (e.g., validation,
documentation, and distribution)

ACF2C8F7866F421F8583D7DBA1CB512F.description: Determine packaging requirements (e.g., type of bags, syringes, glass, PVC, child resistant, light resistant)

5FD817228756420499F6BDE731F49AD9.description:
Label drug products accurately, including auxiliary labels (e.g., poison, shake well before using, store away
from direct sunlight, for external use only, take on empty stomach)

BE4D960F8A1146ABA6EA757AED12000A.description: Calculate and measure medications using a manual or automated system

5638E28281FC469CBCDC9219454415A5.description: Follow the established protocol for retrieving drugs from inventory and preparing medications

0322B369E44B45DF804C76CF3688CB30.description:
Check prescriptions or medication order for completeness (e.g., patient, physician, medication information,
dosing instructions), accuracy, authenticity, legality, and reimbursement eligibility

9480945382A147E681498414BA4086F7.description: Use database software to enter, retrieve, and maintain prescription and refill information

E4F67B49F96B4B49A00A8477E7E1312A.description: Use infection control standards and aseptic technique in the admixture of sterile products

FC78594FE22A4D11925E01DE12B085DA.description: Follow safety protocols in the preparation of all medications

E6AEDE06DD6F4DBCB5DA7C0C2DC8F721.description:
Prepare medications within the scope of practice as documented in the Arizona Board of Pharmacy laws and
regulations

BE36FBAB611A45458F54A10F21849DC4.description: DEMONSTRATE PROCEDURES FOR RECEIVING AND PROCESSING PRESCRIPTIONS AND REFILLS

93F5CC1FD9194CFEBADDF7C7A5DEE7A8.description: Recognize adverse drug-related emergencies and take appropriate first aid action

95CF5C448DCA4C50938588DF846AD5CD.description:
Obtain and maintain training or certification in cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), automated external
defibrillator (AED), foreign body airway obstruction (FBAO), and first aid

DEAFC84F45854813B351965067EF3708.description: Identify types of CPR (e.g., infant, child, and adult)

253152FF38504D908FFD6D0BAC2E8EBA.description: Describe legal parameters related to the administration of emergency care

670633034D914A4A935ABA5251679E77.description: RECOGNIZE AND RESPOND TO EMERGENCY SITUATIONS

0CCC22BED24449109EFC95DB7516B970.description: Identify high-alert/risk medications (refer to published list)

F8A216ABB9FC4CAC98A1B054A979764B.description:
Identify issues that require pharmacist intervention (e.g., DUR, ADE, OCT recommendation; therapeutic
substitution; misuse; and missed dose)

42BA45C6086B4CF9BB1BAE7134AEB801.description:
Identify requirements for the package insert and medication guidelines (e.g., special directions and
precautions)

86EE6F1BD0AA4D6B8990B7657EE00743.description: Identify methods to reduce errors in prescription or medication orders (e.g., correct patient, look-alike/soundalike medications, tall man lettering, leading and trailing zeroes, and limit use of error prone abbreviations)

283F8B34DC164245A3F1C7B04191CFD8.description: DEMONSTRATE METHODS TO ENSURE MEDICATION SAFETY

F95E5FB3ABB640F98506162601C7990F.description: Identify nonsterile compounding processes (e.g., ointment, lotions, and IV mixing)

7E3AEA0E04F84F568DD8A11BF46D99F5.description: Identify sterile compounding processes (e.g., solutions for injection)

B58733D647C4425F97F8AD6759F96EA4.description: Identify the selection and use of equipment and supplies used in compounding

524F8F5C861C44E8B7C9C2CB2F55D7E0.description: Determine product stability (e.g., beyond use and dating and signs of incompatibility)

E23E00F48A4E4BDFACF083FD1D633FEF.description: Describe documentation requirements (e.g., batch preparation and compounding record)

FDC1C0C3D43448378CEED8A38201A2E6.description: Identify handling and disposal requirements (e.g., receptacles and waste streams)

CA781B123D954095B50A7FB7BDAF5ADA.description:
Describe infection control processes (e.g., hand washing, laminar air flow, clean room, PPE, and universal
precautions)

3DC518681C2A46BF831A9554C1B4F29F.description: DEMONSTRATE AN UNDERSTANDING OF PHARMACY COMPOUNDING

6E760317CC204440825CDA6E3D4D74F0.description:
Discuss over-the-counter medicine precautions (e.g., read and follow all directions on the bottle or box, take
the minimum effective dose, avoid medicine you may be allergic to, call the doctor if you are having a problem
with the medicine)

300152B52EDB4CD5BB161F79E56D39EC.description: Explain safety tips about giving children medicines (e.g., aspirin, fever medicine)

B7BECF6177C847EA9C27081CD55E5518.description:
Explain symptoms to adverse drug reaction (e.g., rash, hives, light headedness, vomiting, migraine) and
adverse effects (e.g., addiction ,miscarriage, bleeding, deafness, depression)

F7BBB753707448C684B2CB3DC3DCD98A.description: Discuss medications that may interact with other medicines and cause serious health problems

9643639572B24654A606DBA31887ACA9.description:
Identify common nonprescription medicines (e.g., antacids, laxatives, cold remedies, allergy remedies, pain
relievers)

E3057D0559DD47F1A0638CD90A96100A.description: Explain common alternative therapies to prescription medications used to t

413E123DEC1045B3BAC2102791EECB81.description:
Explain use and side effects of prescription and nonprescription medications used to treat common disease
states, including those affecting body systems (e.g., hypertension, hypothyroidism, diabetes, weight loss,
cardiovascular disease, asthma, arthritis, insomnia)

F6B10CE5BBCD49DEBBF272B4F03E8221.description: Identify conditions (e.g., pregnancy, breast-feeding, and allergies) affected by drugs

95EE1AA88D6F4C58AE80B2AE32711BAC.description: Identify contraindications to the use of a drug (e.g., drug-disease, drug laboratory, and drug nutrient)

CB061036D4B549318323C6BFED6A7407.description: Identify common drug interactions (e.g., drug-drug, drug-dietary supplement, and drug-OTC)

E4CDC9FA1A1144E48894BC96885A7E5C.description:
DEMONSTRATE AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE USE OF PRESCRIPTION AND NONPRESCRIPTION
MEDICATIONS

E44F1637510A4A12B364AB0881D3E3C2.description:
Use complex mathematical calculations (e.g., molecular formula, power volume formula, drip rates, tic toe
percentage formula, division, ratio/proportion, and percentages)

C1A3571C2DEE41188E9B383A6D427F60.description: Recognize and use metric units of length, weight, volume, and temperature in mathematical problems

A6483C92347A414A9C45691E0DC7008F.description: Use terminology in the solution of math-related problems

D696FCE5558B4E98B5C9CF7C3695A982.description:
Demonstrate the use of Arabic and Roman numerals, weights and measures, conversion in temperature, and
the metric system

0FA68844A49C4B5FAC1CF236E678B9BD.description: Discuss the relationship between state and federal laws and regulations as related to pharmacy

0244103ECF58473D87EA42AA2E4BA0E9.description:
Explain the roles and responsibilities of pharmacists, pharmacy technicians, and other pharmacy employees
according to the Board of Pharmacy (BOP)

03DF1A951B0D43A08C8D1A75B56416F5.description: Explain the FDA mandatory versus voluntary recall classification

2A1E78F0B8A240EFB12CED7E721AA9C4.description: Explain the requirement for patient consultations by a pharmacist according to OBRA

A45FA8EC69074BA7B5034324C08BFE51.description:
Identify professional standards related to data integrity, security, and confidentiality (e.g., HIPAA, backing up
and archiving records)

1E0192FA4A2543A8B9D0ECD255703F2B.description:
Discuss restricted drug programs and related prescription-processing requirements (e.g., FDA’s REMS
Program, prior authorization, Medicare and Medicaid Insurance restrictions, and drugs such as thalidomide,
isotretinoin, and clozapine with special requirements)

2C6E7A19F4734BCBAA93D205FB7E82A8.description:
Describe requirements for recording keeping, documentation, and record retention, (e.g., length of time
prescriptions are maintained, repackaged products, recalled products and supplies, and invoices)

26E3535A99BD414E830027CAF07CEE70.description: Identify the formula use to verify the validity of a prescriber’s DEA number

271EF51E6A92492CB4292279DB131999.description:
4 Identify the documentation requirements for receiving, ordering, returning, loss/theft, and destruction of
controlled substances as specified by DEA

154DEF9EAF8B403D92F0C667B80E541F.description: Explain controlled substance transfer regulations according to DEA

6A444686067E4C16BED2BA8ADDDB4C30.description: Explain hazardous substances exposure, prevention, and treatment (e.g., eyewash, spill kit, and SDSs)

64A77FD1DBA948E88ECBE9FBDE73E1C3.description:
1 Identify methods used to store, handle, and dispose of hazardous substances and wastes according to federal
standards

F2E5580FE48943908E759688184B7BBE.description: IDENTIFY MEDICAL AND LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS RELATED TO THE PRACTICE OF PHARMACY

B3BA0253C65744A4AAC3FC0655806696.description: Use common pharmaceutical and medical terminology

8BE43589D783485083423F94F5D4C8EF.description: Distinguish among drug abuse, dependence, and tolerance

A33526DA1FA54E708904D3F805FA4278.description: Explain the minimum and maximum in determining the strength and dose of medications

F22ADFF49B844240A678D2AC4F37E393.description: Define major symbols and abbreviations used on prescriptions and state their meaning

53BC1F6F365946519BC291B0A62C7DB9.description: Identify common categories of drugs, naming stems that enable identification of the category

4163F6AD529E4173A2A12B7AAB81F9BB.description: Differentiate between medications’ generic (trade) names and brand names

01D075CA751F46D486F5EA5FD28BF6E1.description: Identify the top 200 drugs and match them to indications
